We returned from the 3 days official visit to Latvia and Lithuania from the Baltic countries the evening before the previous day. http://t.co/ngbvbielkv
In both countries we were welcomed with great hospitality in snowy and cold weather. http://t.co/biyewo0fod
During the wreath-laying ceremony, students from the Latvian universities under the Erasmus student exchange program ...
We had every partisan MPs in our car. We visited the Latvian Parliament with them http://t.co/ho8m7yxirW
During our visit, the weather in Riga was closed and snowy.
... greeted with the President of Latvia. http://t.co/jexuz7f2fv
We took a short tour in the streets of Riga, finding opportunity between our busy agenda. http://t.co/zcw3xvjlff
We signed a friendship agreement with the Baltic states in 1924. These countries were then occupied by the Soviets and then the Nazis ...
... and then the Soviets annexed it again by occupation. The Eastern Bloc has remained that way until it collapses.
These tables are on the walls of the history museums of these countries. http://t.co/cynjbqb54n
Turkey is one of the countries that has never known the occupation and annexation. We've always been proud of it.
After Latvia, our second stop on our trip was to Lithuania's capital Vilnius. the http://t.co/vknsnsqlc
It was great to catch up with Australian PM @JuliaGillard who is also in #China for the Boao Forum. http://t.co/4fbcYhH0Lx
Here was a warm welcome despite the cold weather. the http://t.co/m5t9d5suu
While we were a bit wandering in the snow-covered streets of Vilnius, we met with Turkish university students. the http://t.co/pxcwt3zvs
They all appreciated their lives.
I realized the opening of the Islamic Cultural Center, which Muslims living in Lithuania use for many purposes.
These beautiful guys in the cultural center sing to us. http://t.co/wlkmxwtntv
We put a wreath in the military ceremony at the unknown soldier monuments. http://t.co/jorcfpaıc0
We went to both countries with a crowded business delegation. Business people have made very important business negotiations.

Thanks to an agreement between workers and companies, the port strike has come to an end.
Special thanks to Minister Evelyn Matthei and to so many people of goodwill who made an enormous contribution to this.
I call on all workers and employers to always privilege the paths of dialogue and agreements.
Thus we will find good solutions to protect legitimate workers' rights and, at the same time, which economy can continue to grow
